Swiss Serius Bidik Wisatawan Indonesia
06 Nov 2019, 06:00 by Johanes Randy Prakoso


Ilustrasi danau di Jenewa (iStock)

Jakarta - Dikenal akan panorama alamnya yang indah, Swiss sukses menarik hati turis Indonesia. Kini, Switzerland Tourism pun mulai serius mengincar wisatawan Indonesia.Hal itu pun diungkapkan oleh perwakilan Switzerland Tourism yang membawahi pasar Asia Tenggara, Ivan Breiter saat berdialog dengan rekan media di The Residence ONFIVE, Hotel Grand Hyatt, Jakarta Pusat, Selasa (5/11/2019).Dikenal sebagai negara terpadat ke-empat di dunia, pasar Indonesia disebut Ivan sangat menjanjikan. Faktanya, tak sedikit wisatawan Indonesia yang menjadikan Swiss sebagai destinasi liburan premium saat berkunjung ke Benua Biru."Dari Januari ke September 2019, jumlah turis Indonesia yang liburan ke Swiss mengalami peningkatan sekitar 4,8%," ujar Ivan saat melakukan presentasi.


EVP Head of Marketing Global Switzerland Tourism, Andre Hefti (kiri) (Randy/detikcom)

Selama tahun 2018, tercatat lebih dari 97 ribu overnights dari wisatawan Indonesia. Tren positif ini diprediksi akan menembus angka lebih dari 100 ribu overnights tahun ini.Ditambahkan oleh Ivan, pihaknya memang berharap dapat meningkatkan jumlah kunjungan wisatawan Indonesia yang liburan ke Swiss. Walau Swiss dikenal sebagai destinasi premium, pasar Indonesia disebutnya cukup positif."Dengan pertumbuhan masyarakat kelas menengah Indonesia, targetnya kami berharap dapat meningkatkan jumlah wisatawan," ujar Ivan.Dalam kesempatan yang sama, EVP Head of Marketing Global Switzerland Tourism, Andre Hefti, turut menjelaskan tema kampanye pihaknya. Yang diusung adalah tentang keindahan Swiss."Swiss terkenal dengan variasi destinasi wisata, namun kami ingin lebih fokus untuk menghadirkan pengalaman yang berbeda bagi wisatawan," ujar Andre.Tahun ini, pihak Switzerland Tourism menawarkan slogan bertema 'Our Nature Energises You.' Sesuai dengan slogan tersebut, pihak Switzerland Tourism berharap agar wisatawan yang liburan ke Swiss dapat merasakan energi dari alam saat berkunjung ke Swiss.Simak Video "Melihat Eloknya Jakarta dari Lensa Kamera"[Gambas:Video 20detik](rdy/krs)

Switzerland Seriously Targets Indonesian Tourists
Nov 6, 2019, 06:00 by Johanes Randy Prakoso


Illustration of lake in Geneva (iStock)

Jakarta - Known for its beautiful natural panorama, Switzerland successfully attracted the hearts of Indonesian tourists. Now, Switzerland Tourism has begun to seriously target Indonesian tourists. That was also revealed by representatives of Switzerland Tourism who oversees the Southeast Asian market, Ivan Breiter during a dialogue with media partners at The Residence ONFIVE, Grand Hyatt Hotel, Central Jakarta, Tuesday (5/11 / 2019). Known as the fourth most populous country in the world, the Indonesian market called Ivan is very promising. In fact, not a few Indonesian tourists who make Switzerland as a premium vacation destination when visiting the Continent of Blue. "From January to September 2019, the number of Indonesian tourists vacationing in Switzerland has increased about 4.8%," Ivan said during a presentation.


EVP Head of Marketing for Global Switzerland Tourism, Andre Hefti (left) (Randy / detikcom)

During 2018, there were more than 97 thousand overnights from Indonesian tourists. This positive trend is predicted to penetrate more than 100 thousand overnights this year. Added by Ivan, it really hopes to increase the number of Indonesian tourists visiting Switzerland. Although Switzerland is known as a premium destination, the Indonesian market is said to be quite positive. "With the growth of Indonesia's middle class, we hope to increase the number of tourists," Ivan said. explaining the campaign theme of his party. "Switzerland is famous for a variety of tourist destinations, but we want to focus more on presenting a different experience for tourists," said Andre. This year, Switzerland Tourism offers a slogan entitled 'Our Nature Energizes You.' In accordance with the slogan, the Swiss Tourism side hopes that tourists who vacation in Switzerland can feel the energy from nature when visiting Switzerland.
